SEARCH
Package com.example.hive.Controllers

Class FacilityController

java.lang.Object
com.example.hive.Controllers.FirebaseController
com.example.hive.Controllers.FacilityController
public class FacilityController extends FirebaseController
Controller to handle facility-related operations in the Firestore database. Extends FirebaseController for base database functionality.
Author:
Zach

  • Method Details

    • getUserFacilityDetails

      public void getUserFacilityDetails(String deviceId, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Facility> listener)
      Retrieves facility details for a user based on their device ID. Gets the user's facility ID and fetches corresponding facility details.
      Parameters:
      deviceId - The device ID of the user
      listener - Callback to handle the retrieved Facility object

    • addFacility

      public void addFacility(android.content.Context context, String deviceID, String name, String email, String phone, @Nullable android.net.Uri picture, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Boolean> listener)
      Adds a new facility to the database and links it to a user. Handles optional facility picture upload using ImageController.
      Parameters:
      context - Application context for image handling
      deviceID - The device ID of the user creating the facility
      name - The name of the facility
      email - The email address for the facility
      phone - The phone number for the facility
      picture - Optional Uri of the facility's picture
      listener - Callback to handle the success/failure of the operation

    • editFacility

      public void editFacility(android.content.Context context, String deviceID, HashMap<String,Object> data, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Boolean> listener)
      Updates an existing facility's information. Handles updating or removing facility pictures and other facility data.
      Parameters:
      context - Application context for image handling
      deviceID - The device ID of the user editing the facility
      data - HashMap containing the fields to update and their new values
      listener - Callback to handle the success/failure of the operation

    • deleteFacility

      public void deleteFacility(String deviceID, com.google.android.gms.tasks.OnSuccessListener<Boolean> listener)
      Deletes a facility and removes the facility ID from the associated user.
      Parameters:
      deviceID - The device ID of the user whose facility should be deleted
      listener - Callback to handle the success/failure of the deletion
